title: Fixed urgent bug regarding Search Frag's external searches
message:
Fixed urgent bug regarding Search Frag's external searches

[Fix]: When SearchResultsFragment had search issued to it with a
destroyed view (e.g. after rotation), it would fail. This is because the
loading views would be invalid can cause (caught) null exceptions. The
solution is multi-faceted: 
1. Check that views are non-null (solves exceptions)
2. Use the state values for: prevQuery and loading bools only if said
variables are not already set (such as a current search)

The second part is important for displaying the correct loading
animations + correct search summaries

[Mod]: Updated version code/name for release (1.0.0)
    
Version 1.0.0:
-Added search tags
-Added fade animations to search + job descriptions
-Added background fade to the search bar dialog
-Added progress count to the search loading
-Fixed job descriptions scroll, misfirings, & flickering bugs

title: Fixed tags' functioning & styling in 2.3.3, fixed tag hiding
message:
Fixed tags' functioning & styling in 2.3.3, fixed tag hiding

[Fix]: CareerItemFragment - 
- The tag hiding now works correctly; it was restoring from state
(disabled this)
- Fixed the tag click to work via a WebViewClient method as the
JavaScript method has bugs in some versions of 2.3.3

[Fix]: Fixed styles to work with 2.3.3; required :hover in css

title: Fixed the "retry" error for tag searches on mobile
message:
Fixed the "retry" error for tag searches on mobile

The problem was caused by sending 2 requests in quick succession, in
which one fails, providing the error.

[Fix]: CareersStackOverflowModel -
- Ensured only one request can be sent at a time (sending -1 if another
is made).
- Fixed the cancel query; it was responding with REQUEST_QUERY_CANCEL
instead of NOTIFY_CANCELLED_QUERY.

[Mod][Fix]: SearchResultsFragment -
- Ensured that starting requests (in onCreateView) are only sent if
there are no current requests
- Added (null) safety check for the progress textView
- Added extra debugging to view updates
 
[Doc]: Updated wrapper documentation

message:

- Added the count updates to text display in Search Frag

fragment would be stuck spinning forever because the boolean never got
switched before destruction. This is solved by synchronizing on the
model.
- Fixed refresh bug where the current search was always the argments.
Solution was switching the clean from = new Bundle() to .clear().

title: Fixed sroll+misfire issue + added a potential flickering fix
message:
Fixed sroll+misfire issue + added a potential flickering fix

This commit addresses issue #11

[Fix]: CareerItemFragment
-The scroll issue was a two-fold issue. First cause by the fact that the
view height would be incomplete until the WebView loads AND as such the
scroll view ignores its height. To remedy it, the scroll is set using
the sum of scroll + webview heights, and is set on webview load
- The misfire issue is simply fixed by checking the height at load and,
if 0, it forces a reload. Reloads typically never exceed 2, but 5 is set
as a safety.

[Mod][Fix]: Potential fix for flicking on the WebView. This occurs when
2D Hardware acceleration is forced on some devices. To fix this no
transparency (the reason it was turned of) is used and the background
are set via careerstack_background_colour. This is not yet tested.

issue.

title: Reorganzied code & fixed spacing issues that sometimes crop up
message:
Reorganzied code & fixed spacing issues that sometimes crop up

[Ref]: Moved font code to top, spacing code to bottom.
[Fix][Mod]: When employer post jobs, they sometimes use different HTML
styling to achieve the same look. Sometimes this results in an awful
rending with excessive spacing. These changes are to fix that.

In essense:
-Remove ALL br near list elements, ul/ol lists, paragraphs
-Ensure that indents next to strongs (a make shift header) still work
-Added some extra spacing to list elements and paragraphs to reduce
crowding

I also changed the URL link blue.

[Doc]: Added version number

Noting this has not been yet tested on all resolutions. This solves some
issues in issue #13.

title: Fixes to ad list,main view,search dialog.Padding added to listview
message:
Fixes to ad list,main view,search dialog.Padding added to listview 

Important fixes!

[Fix]: Ad count was returning incorrectly due to using:
"if (position < minimumSize)" instead of "if (position <
firstAdPosition)". As such the first ad would overwrite the respective
element. This is fixed.
[Fix]: The edit text views were set to limit themselves when on larger
devices. This was not done for the distance slider. This has been
corrected.
[Fix]: The search dialog on 2.3.3 had edit views spilling over multiple
lines. Fixed this by setting ellipsize="end" instead of "none".

[Mod]: Added padding to listview bottom via clipToPadding=false +
footerDividersEnabled=false.
[Doc]: Updated PreferenceUtils documentation

- Added drawable strip attribute to the dark and light themes. Light
theme set it to @null (transparent) while Dark theme set it to orange
strip
[Mod]: Added strip as background search bar dialog background

[Mod]: Switched order of refresh & search. This is for future
compatibility as it is likely planned that the "Career Item" fragment
will be capable of search (thus needs to be aligned right).
Additionally, it makes refreshing a more intentional action while search
may be pressed if the setting drop down is hit.

title: [Mod]: Updated version code/name for next release
message:
[Mod]: Updated version code/name for next release

Version 0.2.0; with search bar

title: Added translations for refresh + quick switch themes, renamed id
message:
Added translations for refresh + quick switch themes, renamed id

[Mod]: Renamed string names from "searchResults" to "searchBar"
[Mod]: Added translations for "Refresh" and "Quick Switch Theme"
strings, including:
-de (German)
-es (Spanish)
-fr (French)
-nl (Dutch)

title: [Doc][Rea]: Removed uncessary TODOs & extra imports
message: [Doc][Rea]: Removed uncessary TODOs & extra imports

title: Moved from SearchResultsFrag->SearchBarDia.,change refresh+search
message:
Moved from SearchResultsFrag->SearchBarDia.,change refresh+search 

[Mod]: Added menu items for:
-Search
-Refresh
[Mod]: Changed the SearchResults behaviour to show "retry" only an error
occurs when NOT cancelled. 

[Ref][Add]: Moved the search functionality from the
SearchResultsFragment to the newly created SearchBarDialogFragment. Said
fragment:
-Maintains the actionbar theme
-Slides in/out from the top
-Display multiple views (no retain instances!)
-Fill the horizontal width
-Adjust for the copy/paste bar in higher version
-Send back search params on "Search" 

SearchResultsFragment now has public methods for receiving requests.

[Mod]: MainActivity made to:
-Add/Remove action bar icons, depending the page
-Refresh results
-Search results using the fragment

title: Added string + image resources for refresh
message:
Added string + image resources for refresh

[Add]: Added refresh icon for multiple res (pngcrushed)

title: Light theme now given a custom actionbar color+styles for the dialog
message:
Light theme now given a custom actionbar color+styles for the dialog

[Mod]: Added light actionbar colour
[Mod]: Added attribute to match the actionbar colour. This is used in
the dialog styles
[Mod]: Set Light theme action bar colour.
[Mod]: For the search dialog, created:
-A style for the dialog to be the right size
-Style for the dialog animationes
-(Action Bar) Theme for the dialog. This is rather important for the
styling of buttons + copy/paste actionbar pop-in in later versions.

[Rem]: removed the styles for v14 as it was not needed + annoying. It
can be added back if required; just remember to copy the required
attributes.

title: Added basics for the SearchBar dialog layout, including animations
message:
Added basics for the SearchBar dialog layout, including animations

[Add]: Created transparent button drawable for the back button of search
bar
[Mod]: Added dimens for the margins of dialog
[Add]: Created dialog layout for search bar including dismiss/back
button
[Add]: Added alternative layouts for the EditText fields (both for 2.3.3
& modern devices)

[Mod]: Added limit for the timing speed of searchbar animation
[Add]: Added animation for sliding: in+down and out+up

title: [Fix]: Parcelling in CareeItem was broken & now fixed
message:
[Fix]: Parcelling in CareeItem was broken & now fixed

IMPORTANT FIX! 

The Parcelable was broken in multiple ways (no dates, no company names).
This caused crashing when the activity was trying to restore.

title: Changed Activity flow,add quick-switch theme & location+keyword pref
message:
Changed Activity flow,add quick-switch theme & location+keyword pref

[Mod]: MainActivity & SettingsFragment - 
Added ablity to "quick switch" themes for 3.0+ (Honeycomb+) devices;
uses the super.recreate() method. Note that this does not work with all
devices (Closes issue #2)

[Mod]: MainFragment now sets/restores the location + keyword preferences
based on the bool for Search Settings. Additionally, updated content
description on seekbar.

[Mod]: All fragments now offer interfaces for Activity interaction
(where needed)
[Mod]: MainActivity now oversees all fragments and dicates what their
basic requests will do.See issue #3.

[Dep]: Deprecated the old listener OnFragmentRequestListener; it was
really just for fun

title: Renamed strings & added strings for quick switch themes
message:
Renamed strings & added strings for quick switch themes

[Ref]: Renamed the "Yes, Restart" dialog alert for general use. 
[Mod]: Added strings for "quick theme switch" setting & dialog. 

See issue #2

NOTE: Quick switch theme strings does NOT include translations for:
-de
-es
-fr
-nl

title: Added quick switch & location+keywords prefs, fixed location dialog
message:
Added quick switch & location+keywords prefs, fixed location dialog

[Mod]: Added preferences for remembering keywords + location text, in
addition to the  "quick theme switch" boolean (See issue #2)

[Fix]: Updated distance dialog to have distance colour assigned by
attribute + theme. This allows the older alert box themes to use default
colour text.

[Mod]: Corrected accessibility content description for seekbar in dialog

[Doc]: Updated documention on SeekBarWrapper

title: [Fix]: MainActivity backbutton press to give consistent results
message:
[Fix]: MainActivity backbutton press to give consistent results

The hardware button was not giving the same results as actionbar; forgot
to called onSupportNavigateUp() in onBackPressed()

[Mod]: Updated version code/name for next release

title: [Mod]: Updated the launcher icons again for release
message:
[Mod]: Updated the launcher icons again for release

Mild redesign on icons; 3 bars instead of 6

title: Added resources for niche locale cases, such as units & example
message:
Added resources for niche locale cases, such as units & example

[Add]: Added a symlink/file for values-en as a safety (it would not
resolve to values if "-en-rGB" exists)
[Add]: Added specific location examples for:
-Australia (en-rAU)
-Canada (en-rCA, fr-rCa)
-Great Britian (en-rGB)
-US (es-rUS)

[Add]: Added units as metric for Australia, German, French, Canada,
Dutch/Netherlands. Pretty much everywhere but US & Great Britian

title: [Add]: Added strings translations in prep for release
message:
[Add]: Added strings translations in prep for release

Foreign languages include:
-Dutch (nl)

title: Fixed important issues for layouts, adapter & mainfrag backstack
message:

settings

settings menu (what?)

(Was forgetting to clear the subtext in holder pattern).

mucking up the layout

title: Minor logtag correction, method visibility, & doc update
message:

logtag now refers to abstract class

title: Fixed the disable button text & distance dialog styling
message:

distance dialog to be default alert style
[Add]: Added my own custom text states for buttons; disabled buttons now
show as grey text, enabled as their appropriate text

title: Main to use more reliable theme switching & used new confirm dialog
message:

theme; additionally, it will prompt the user for sure

title: Implemented preferences into all frags & activity
message:
Implemented preferences into all frags & activity

prefs (via UnitCheck) into all fragments. Of special note is the
CareerItemFragment must now watch it's view for backstack safety

title: Intro SettingsFragment, based on the PreferenceFragment library
message:
Intro SettingsFragment, based on the PreferenceFragment library

[Add]: Added SettingsFragment & dependencies which can:
-Set settings
-Reset settings (with alert prompt)
-Show build number

title: Added Prefs, unit check util & a share intent utility
message:
Added Prefs, unit check util & a share intent utility

[Add]: PreferenceUtils and preference_info.xml outlining the default
preferences and their values
[Add]: UnitCheck is a custom util for this project; checks the units
preference bool and responds with appropriate string from resources.
[Add]: ShareIntentUtil generates a share intent, handling outlier such
as facebook's refusing content messages. Includes a browser fallback for
facebook when not on the device.

title: [Rea][Mod]: Added custom row layout for adapter & tidied some code
message:
[Rea][Mod]: Added custom row layout for adapter & tidied some code

Layout now uses a smaller text size and bold for the jobtitles.

title: Add ability to query to search results & ref/mod career item layout
message:
Add ability to query to search results & ref/mod career item layout

[Mod]: Added margins to dimens
[Mod]: Added ability to query results to SearchResultsFragment,
including all rotation handling, all error handling, all retry handling,
etc.

Additonally, adjusted the layout's margins.

[Mod][Ref]: CareerItem's layout got an id in the scrollview, refactored
out all margins to dimens. Furthemore, now it retains the scroll
position.

title: Added request + parser Wrapper & added async model for this app
message:
Added request + parser Wrapper & added async model for this app

[Add]: Created Wrapper to easily contain any changes necessary for
request + parsing interaction. More importantly, it provides a means to
"pause" the output until the model can reattach to the thread it is
running in.
[Add]: Added the primary AsyncModel for this application. It receives
requests and publishes results, errors, etc. in a simple form.

title: Added the request builder & xml parser for the rss feed
message:
Added the request builder & xml parser for the rss feed

[Add]: Added CareersStackOverflowRssRequest to build the request via the
Builder pattern. 
[Add]: Added CareersStackOverflowRssXmlParser to parse the response from
CareersStackOverflowRssRequest. Ensures to use the checkPause() method
and yields every 250 records (so as not to be overly greedy). Makes use
of the CareerItem object

title: Moved & enhanced the abstract requests and parsers
message:
Moved & enhanced the abstract requests and parsers

[Ref][Mod]: AbstractSimpleHttpRequest  -
- Moved from "listeners" to "requests" subpackage
- Fixed synchronization
- Increased safety in closing/disconnecting
- Increased listener safety
- Introduced a cancel() method
- Added a better way to encourage proper request preparation
- Added better exception handling for timeouts (catch
SocketTimeoutException)
- Added better debugging info to toString()

[Mod]: Introduced pause() & resume() into AbstractXmlParser

title: Added AsyncModel & RunnableHeadlessFragment from CurrencyConverter
message:
Added AsyncModel & RunnableHeadlessFragment from CurrencyConverter

[Add]: Added AsyncModel from CurrencyConverter - basic outline on how to
run a sync model via handlers
[Add]: RunnableHeadlessFragment for simply running runnables in a
persistent thread.
